definition: to take turns/to work by roster
wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn
to substitute for/to take the place of/to replace/for/on behalf of/to stand in for

sentences.english: Their starting rotation is the strongest in baseball.
sentences.chinese: 他们的起点轮替是棒球史上最强的。

sentences.english: He knows the rising and declining of life is actually the secret of evolution.
sentences.chinese: 他知道，万物兴衰的轮替，实际上是生物演化的契机。

definition: to take over (from one another)/to alternate/to replace/to relay
to replace sb (personnel, sports team player etc)/substitution
to transform/to convert/to vary/to alternate/a transformation
to be keen to .../to be anxious to ...
to ebb and rise/to decrease and then grow
formation (of a sports team, troops etc)
variant of 重疊|重叠[chong2 die2]
to be on call/to be on standby
nothing much changes (idiom); always the same/stuck in a rut
to adopt (a system, policy, strategy etc)
